projects.description: I have successfully identified and addressed footfall challenges in Titan and Adidas showrooms across Bangalore, Hubli, and Mangalore, enhancing customer engagement and sales performance. By preparing detailed reports with actionable insights, I supported service improvements and operational efficiency, contributing to the overall success of the retail operations.- Conducted covert store visits, assessing staff behavior, customer service quality, and adherence to company standards.-Conducted covert audits across multiple retail locations, evaluating staff adherence to brand guidelines and customer service quality.- Assessed customer experience, identifying key strengths and improvement areas, leading to a 20% increase in customer satisfaction ratings based on follow-up assessments.- Developed comprehensive reports with actionable feedback, driving enhancements in service protocols and operational efficiency, contributing to a 15% improvement in store compliance.- To achieve these results, I evaluated the overall customer experience, identifying strengths and areas for improvement in staff interactions.- Composed detailed reports summarizing observations, providing actionable feedback to enhance service and operational efficiency.- Demonstrated keen attention to detail and objective analysis to support the continuous improvement of customer satisfaction initiatives.

recommendations: Anant Pal Rastogi ‚ÄúI had the pleasure of working with Garima Goel during her tenure as a Talent Resource Consultant at Microsoft, where she demonstrated exceptional skills in sourcing and acquiring top-tier talent for the organization. Garima's ability to identify and attract the best candidates in the industry is truly remarkable. She has a deep understanding of the talent market and utilizes innovative strategies to connect with potential hires. Her keen eye for matching candidates to the right roles ensured not just a good fit but also long-term success for both the employees and the organization. What sets Garima apart is her unwavering professionalism, strong work ethic, and ability to build genuine relationships with candidates and stakeholders alike. Her collaborative approach and attention to detail made the entire recruitment process seamless and efficient. Working with Garima was an absolute privilege. I am confident that her expertise and dedication will continue to drive success in her future endeavors. I wholeheartedly recommend her to any organization looking for a top-notch talent acquisition professional.‚Äù

Meenakshi Kaushik ‚ÄúI had the pleasure of collaborating with Garima Goel at Momagic. Even though we were in sister concern, her exceptional HR acumen and strategic leadership were evident. Garima is a skilled HR professional with a keen eye for talent acquisition, employee development, and organizational culture. Her ability to build strong teams and foster a positive work environment is truly commendable. She's a valuable asset, streamlining processes and driving results. I wholeheartedly recommend her for any HR leadership role.‚Äù

projects.title: Couchbase integration with selenium framework
projects.description: Cvent was using SQL Server as database initially. But at requirement increases Couchbase (NoSQL) database was introduced. For automation testing, using SQL was easy as it supports sql based queries. Since couchbase doesn't support such queries, searching/sorting/filtering must be done at framework level. So I did the integrating of couchbase so that documents (JSON) could be fetched, filtered, sorted at the framework level (written in JAVA, selenium).Project took around 2 months of planning, development and testing.

detailed_profile.name: Chirag Maini
detailed_profile.about: They say Electrical Engineers light up the world ‚Äî I guess I just chose to light up servers instead. I'm a final-year Electrical Engineering student at NSUT who realized that while circuits are cool, building scalable backend systems and deploying them to the cloud is way cooler. Somewhere between solving Kirchhoff‚Äôs laws and debugging Python scripts at 2 AM, I found my passion for Software Engineering ‚Äî especially backend development and DevOps. I work with Node.js, Express.js, Spring Boot, Python, Java, AWS, and Kubernetes. I love deploying servers, managing cloud infrastructure, and fixing things when they break (because let‚Äôs be honest ‚Äî things will break). Fun fact: while others panic when something crashes, I somehow get more energetic, treating it like a treasure hunt for solutions. Currently, I‚Äôm diving deep into DevOps culture and cloud platforms, aiming to build systems that are reliable, scalable, and slightly less dramatic than my caffeine habits. Always excited to connect with fellow tech enthusiasts, backend nerds, and anyone who believes that "it worked on my machine" is not a valid deployment strategy.

projects.title: Couchbase integration with selenium framework
projects.description: Cvent was using SQL Server as database initially. But at requirement increases Couchbase (NoSQL) database was introduced. For automation testing, using SQL was easy as it supports sql based queries. Since couchbase doesn't support such queries, searching/sorting/filtering must be done at framework level. So I did the integrating of couchbase so that documents (JSON) could be fetched, filtered, sorted at the framework level (written in JAVA, selenium).Project took around 2 months of planning, development and testing.

projects.title: Couchbase integration with selenium framework
projects.description: Cvent was using SQL Server as database initially. But at requirement increases Couchbase (NoSQL) database was introduced. For automation testing, using SQL was easy as it supports sql based queries. Since couchbase doesn't support such queries, searching/sorting/filtering must be done at framework level. So I did the integrating of couchbase so that documents (JSON) could be fetched, filtered, sorted at the framework level (written in JAVA, selenium).Project took around 2 months of planning, development and testing.

detailed_profile.name: Chirag Maini
detailed_profile.about: They say Electrical Engineers light up the world ‚Äî I guess I just chose to light up servers instead. I'm a final-year Electrical Engineering student at NSUT who realized that while circuits are cool, building scalable backend systems and deploying them to the cloud is way cooler. Somewhere between solving Kirchhoff‚Äôs laws and debugging Python scripts at 2 AM, I found my passion for Software Engineering ‚Äî especially backend development and DevOps. I work with Node.js, Express.js, Spring Boot, Python, Java, AWS, and Kubernetes. I love deploying servers, managing cloud infrastructure, and fixing things when they break (because let‚Äôs be honest ‚Äî things will break). Fun fact: while others panic when something crashes, I somehow get more energetic, treating it like a treasure hunt for solutions. Currently, I‚Äôm diving deep into DevOps culture and cloud platforms, aiming to build systems that are reliable, scalable, and slightly less dramatic than my caffeine habits. Always excited to connect with fellow tech enthusiasts, backend nerds, and anyone who believes that "it worked on my machine" is not a valid deployment strategy.

detailed_profile.name: Aastha Srivastava
detailed_profile.position: Program Manager At BharatPe | Technical Project Manager | Certified Professional Scrum Master (PSM-1) | Driving Excellence in Execution & Delivery at BharatPe
detailed_profile.about: Program and Project Manager at Bharatpe, With a solid foundation in Agile methodologies and a PSM-1 certification, I specialise in leading cross-functional teams to deliver projects on time and within budget, ensuring alignment with business objectives. My expertise spans Agile, Scrum, Waterfall, risk management, and stakeholder engagement, supported by proficiency in tools like Jira, Asana, and Trello. Previously, at Squareboat Solutions, I managed high-value projects across diverse domains, from pharmaceuticals to EdTech, achieving significant improvements in efficiency and productivity. With a strong background in incident and request management during my tenure at Tata Consultancy Services, I bring a comprehensive skill set to ensure seamless project execution. Awards such as "Star of the Year" and multiple "Employee of the Month" recognitions underscore my commitment to excellence. A strategic thinker and problem-solver, I thrive on optimizing processes and delivering quality outcomes that drive business value.

experience.title: Territory Manager
experience.description: As Territory Manager at BharatPe I am responsible for overseeing and driving the growth of the company's financial products and services within a designated geographical area. This role involves building and maintaining relationships with merchants, understanding their needs, and promoting BharatPe's payment solutions and lending products. The Territory Manager works to expand the customer base, achieve sales targets, and ensure customer satisfaction, while collaborating with other teams to optimize business operations and increase market share in the region.

detailed_profile.name: Chirag Maini
detailed_profile.about: They say Electrical Engineers light up the world ‚Äî I guess I just chose to light up servers instead. I'm a final-year Electrical Engineering student at NSUT who realized that while circuits are cool, building scalable backend systems and deploying them to the cloud is way cooler. Somewhere between solving Kirchhoff‚Äôs laws and debugging Python scripts at 2 AM, I found my passion for Software Engineering ‚Äî especially backend development and DevOps. I work with Node.js, Express.js, Spring Boot, Python, Java, AWS, and Kubernetes. I love deploying servers, managing cloud infrastructure, and fixing things when they break (because let‚Äôs be honest ‚Äî things will break). Fun fact: while others panic when something crashes, I somehow get more energetic, treating it like a treasure hunt for solutions. Currently, I‚Äôm diving deep into DevOps culture and cloud platforms, aiming to build systems that are reliable, scalable, and slightly less dramatic than my caffeine habits. Always excited to connect with fellow tech enthusiasts, backend nerds, and anyone who believes that "it worked on my machine" is not a valid deployment strategy.

detailed_profile.name: Chirag Maini
detailed_profile.about: They say Electrical Engineers light up the world ‚Äî I guess I just chose to light up servers instead. I'm a final-year Electrical Engineering student at NSUT who realized that while circuits are cool, building scalable backend systems and deploying them to the cloud is way cooler. Somewhere between solving Kirchhoff‚Äôs laws and debugging Python scripts at 2 AM, I found my passion for Software Engineering ‚Äî especially backend development and DevOps. I work with Node.js, Express.js, Spring Boot, Python, Java, AWS, and Kubernetes. I love deploying servers, managing cloud infrastructure, and fixing things when they break (because let‚Äôs be honest ‚Äî things will break). Fun fact: while others panic when something crashes, I somehow get more energetic, treating it like a treasure hunt for solutions. Currently, I‚Äôm diving deep into DevOps culture and cloud platforms, aiming to build systems that are reliable, scalable, and slightly less dramatic than my caffeine habits. Always excited to connect with fellow tech enthusiasts, backend nerds, and anyone who believes that "it worked on my machine" is not a valid deployment strategy.

projects.title: Couchbase integration with selenium framework
projects.description: Cvent was using SQL Server as database initially. But at requirement increases Couchbase (NoSQL) database was introduced. For automation testing, using SQL was easy as it supports sql based queries. Since couchbase doesn't support such queries, searching/sorting/filtering must be done at framework level. So I did the integrating of couchbase so that documents (JSON) could be fetched, filtered, sorted at the framework level (written in JAVA, selenium).Project took around 2 months of planning, development and testing.

recommendations: Anant Pal Rastogi ‚ÄúI had the pleasure of working with Garima Goel during her tenure as a Talent Resource Consultant at Microsoft, where she demonstrated exceptional skills in sourcing and acquiring top-tier talent for the organization. Garima's ability to identify and attract the best candidates in the industry is truly remarkable. She has a deep understanding of the talent market and utilizes innovative strategies to connect with potential hires. Her keen eye for matching candidates to the right roles ensured not just a good fit but also long-term success for both the employees and the organization. What sets Garima apart is her unwavering professionalism, strong work ethic, and ability to build genuine relationships with candidates and stakeholders alike. Her collaborative approach and attention to detail made the entire recruitment process seamless and efficient. Working with Garima was an absolute privilege. I am confident that her expertise and dedication will continue to drive success in her future endeavors. I wholeheartedly recommend her to any organization looking for a top-notch talent acquisition professional.‚Äù

Meenakshi Kaushik ‚ÄúI had the pleasure of collaborating with Garima Goel at Momagic. Even though we were in sister concern, her exceptional HR acumen and strategic leadership were evident. Garima is a skilled HR professional with a keen eye for talent acquisition, employee development, and organizational culture. Her ability to build strong teams and foster a positive work environment is truly commendable. She's a valuable asset, streamlining processes and driving results. I wholeheartedly recommend her for any HR leadership role.‚Äù

recommendations: Anant Pal Rastogi ‚ÄúI had the pleasure of working with Garima Goel during her tenure as a Talent Resource Consultant at Microsoft, where she demonstrated exceptional skills in sourcing and acquiring top-tier talent for the organization. Garima's ability to identify and attract the best candidates in the industry is truly remarkable. She has a deep understanding of the talent market and utilizes innovative strategies to connect with potential hires. Her keen eye for matching candidates to the right roles ensured not just a good fit but also long-term success for both the employees and the organization. What sets Garima apart is her unwavering professionalism, strong work ethic, and ability to build genuine relationships with candidates and stakeholders alike. Her collaborative approach and attention to detail made the entire recruitment process seamless and efficient. Working with Garima was an absolute privilege. I am confident that her expertise and dedication will continue to drive success in her future endeavors. I wholeheartedly recommend her to any organization looking for a top-notch talent acquisition professional.‚Äù

Meenakshi Kaushik ‚ÄúI had the pleasure of collaborating with Garima Goel at Momagic. Even though we were in sister concern, her exceptional HR acumen and strategic leadership were evident. Garima is a skilled HR professional with a keen eye for talent acquisition, employee development, and organizational culture. Her ability to build strong teams and foster a positive work environment is truly commendable. She's a valuable asset, streamlining processes and driving results. I wholeheartedly recommend her for any HR leadership role.‚Äù

publications.title: Optimization of edge detection algorithm for digi-tal images through dynamic programming
publications.subtitle: International Journal of Scientific & Engineering Research Volume 9, Issue 4, April-2018 1339ISSN 2229-5518
publications.description: Most of the edge detection algorithms are optimized with classic techniques and I proposed the ‚Äúoptimization of edge detection algorithm for digital images through dynamic programming.‚Äù A dynamic programming technique is proposed for locally finding edges in gray level digital images. A class of characteristic func-tions is proposed from which the best ‚Äúedge function‚Äù (according to an optimality criterion) is chosen for each window by the dynamic pro-gramming technique. The windows are selected by first decomposing the entire image into equal square regions and then breaking into four equal subsquares any region where the quality of fit of the best edge function (as measured by the optimality criterion) falls below a fixed tolerance, and so on. The procedure is summarized in a conceptual algorithm, and the technique is first illustrated by application to a digital image of an artificial design. Second, for comparison, the dynamic programming method and a split-and-merge method are used for image enhancement on a noisy version of a muscle cell culture image. Then the dynamic programming method and a thresholded gradient operator technique are used for edge detection on both the original and the noisy version of this image.

publications.title: Optimizing the performance of Various Edge Detection Algorithms
publications.subtitle: Internation Conference on Technology & Trust
publications.description: Optimizing the performance of edge detection

publications.title: Finding the Optimal Threshold values for Edge Detection of Digital Images & Comparing among Bacterial Foraging Algorithm, Canny and Sobel Edge Detector
publications.subtitle: ICCCA 2017, IEEE
publications.description: In this paper, we will discuss the Quality of Edge Detected at different threshold values. For the purpose we will compare among Bacterial Foraging Algorithm, Canny Edge detector and Sobel Edge Detector. The Algorithm Bacterial Foraging also uses a thickness constraint and follows the Swarm intelligence feature and works like the behavior of bacteria in the search of food, Whereas Canny uses eliminates noise then apply Gaussian Filter and Sobel uses the concept of Image Gradient for Edge detection. In this paper we will observe a common image with different thresholds with different techniques. In the end we will find the optimal values of threshold for each techniques.

publications.subtitle: Ieee Conference

matched.match_rationale: Chirag Maini works in DevOps at BharatPe, which involves backend development and system management. This role has significant overlap with database management and performance tuning.

detailed_profile.name: Chirag Maini
detailed_profile.about: They say Electrical Engineers light up the world ‚Äî I guess I just chose to light up servers instead. I'm a final-year Electrical Engineering student at NSUT who realized that while circuits are cool, building scalable backend systems and deploying them to the cloud is way cooler. Somewhere between solving Kirchhoff‚Äôs laws and debugging Python scripts at 2 AM, I found my passion for Software Engineering ‚Äî especially backend development and DevOps. I work with Node.js, Express.js, Spring Boot, Python, Java, AWS, and Kubernetes. I love deploying servers, managing cloud infrastructure, and fixing things when they break (because let‚Äôs be honest ‚Äî things will break). Fun fact: while others panic when something crashes, I somehow get more energetic, treating it like a treasure hunt for solutions. Currently, I‚Äôm diving deep into DevOps culture and cloud platforms, aiming to build systems that are reliable, scalable, and slightly less dramatic than my caffeine habits. Always excited to connect with fellow tech enthusiasts, backend nerds, and anyone who believes that "it worked on my machine" is not a valid deployment strategy.

recommendations: Anant Pal Rastogi ‚ÄúI had the pleasure of working with Garima Goel during her tenure as a Talent Resource Consultant at Microsoft, where she demonstrated exceptional skills in sourcing and acquiring top-tier talent for the organization. Garima's ability to identify and attract the best candidates in the industry is truly remarkable. She has a deep understanding of the talent market and utilizes innovative strategies to connect with potential hires. Her keen eye for matching candidates to the right roles ensured not just a good fit but also long-term success for both the employees and the organization. What sets Garima apart is her unwavering professionalism, strong work ethic, and ability to build genuine relationships with candidates and stakeholders alike. Her collaborative approach and attention to detail made the entire recruitment process seamless and efficient. Working with Garima was an absolute privilege. I am confident that her expertise and dedication will continue to drive success in her future endeavors. I wholeheartedly recommend her to any organization looking for a top-notch talent acquisition professional.‚Äù

Meenakshi Kaushik ‚ÄúI had the pleasure of collaborating with Garima Goel at Momagic. Even though we were in sister concern, her exceptional HR acumen and strategic leadership were evident. Garima is a skilled HR professional with a keen eye for talent acquisition, employee development, and organizational culture. Her ability to build strong teams and foster a positive work environment is truly commendable. She's a valuable asset, streamlining processes and driving results. I wholeheartedly recommend her for any HR leadership role.‚Äù

experience.title: Territory Manager
experience.description: As Territory Manager at BharatPe I am responsible for overseeing and driving the growth of the company's financial products and services within a designated geographical area. This role involves building and maintaining relationships with merchants, understanding their needs, and promoting BharatPe's payment solutions and lending products. The Territory Manager works to expand the customer base, achieve sales targets, and ensure customer satisfaction, while collaborating with other teams to optimize business operations and increase market share in the region.

detailed_profile.about: Program and Project Manager at Bharatpe, With a solid foundation in Agile methodologies and a PSM-1 certification, I specialise in leading cross-functional teams to deliver projects on time and within budget, ensuring alignment with business objectives. My expertise spans Agile, Scrum, Waterfall, risk management, and stakeholder engagement, supported by proficiency in tools like Jira, Asana, and Trello. Previously, at Squareboat Solutions, I managed high-value projects across diverse domains, from pharmaceuticals to EdTech, achieving significant improvements in efficiency and productivity. With a strong background in incident and request management during my tenure at Tata Consultancy Services, I bring a comprehensive skill set to ensure seamless project execution. Awards such as "Star of the Year" and multiple "Employee of the Month" recognitions underscore my commitment to excellence. A strategic thinker and problem-solver, I thrive on optimizing processes and delivering quality outcomes that drive business value.

experience.title: Territory Manager
experience.description: As Territory Manager at BharatPe I am responsible for overseeing and driving the growth of the company's financial products and services within a designated geographical area. This role involves building and maintaining relationships with merchants, understanding their needs, and promoting BharatPe's payment solutions and lending products. The Territory Manager works to expand the customer base, achieve sales targets, and ensure customer satisfaction, while collaborating with other teams to optimize business operations and increase market share in the region.
